intro: Silene claviformis, commonly known as the club-shaped catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, club-like seed pods. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Silene claviformis is a perennial herb that is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
